Package chess15.gui.controllers

Class ChessController

java.lang.Object
chess15.gui.controllers.ChessController
All Implemented Interfaces:
UIInteface
public class ChessController extends Object implements UIInteface
The ChessController is responsible for everything UI related in the main scene

    • getKeysByValue

      private static <T, E> List<T> getKeysByValue(Map<T,E> map, E value)
      Returns the key of a Map that is in connection with a value This only works for a 1-1 connection so if one value is only connected to one key
      Parameters:
      map - The Map that contains the key value pairs
      value - The value we want the key for
      Returns:
      The key that is connected to the value provided

      private void displayPosibleMoves(ArrayList<Vector2> moves, Vector2 piece)
      Add the possible move marker to the board at the given position list
      Parameters:
      moves - The Vector2 move list that we want to put the marker to
      piece - The Vector2 position of the piece, so we can assign move listener

    • displayFromTo

      private void displayFromTo(Vector2 from, Vector2 to)
      Add the from to move marker to the board at the given position list
      Parameters:
      from - The Vector2 move list that we want to put the marker to
      to - The Vector2 position of the piece, so we can assign move listener

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A string we can add to the list on the side of the board

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(Vector2 from, Vector2 to)
      Handles the piece movement on the board Also handles adding the taken pieces to the list And animates the piece movement
      Parameters:
      from - The Vector2 from position. The origin of the piece
      to - The Vector2 to position. The Position we want to put the piece to

    • remove

      public void remove(Vector2 pieceToRemove, Piece taken)
      Remove a piece from the board and potentially add it to the taken pieces
      Specified by:
      remove in interface UIInteface
      Parameters:
      pieceToRemove - The Vector2 position of the piece we want to remove
      taken - Can be null if we don't want the piece added to the taken list. If not null the provided piece will be added to the taken list

    • aiPromote

      public void aiPromote(Vector2 to)
      Handles the promotion for the chess alg Always chooses queen for simplicity
      Parameters:
      to - The Vector2 position of the promoting pawn

    • promote

      public void promote(Piece.Color color, Vector2 to)
      Handle the promotion of the pieces. Called by the backend
      Specified by:
      promote in interface UIInteface
      Parameters:
      color - The Piece.Color of the Piece being promoted
      to - The current Vector2 position of the pawn. Also, the spawn point for the new Piece

    • endGame

      public void endGame(Piece.Color won, WinReason reason)
      The end game is called when we want to finist the current game. Pauses the timer and puts an overlay on the board with the ending condition
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface UIInteface
      Parameters:
      won - The Piece.Color of the winning side
      reason - The WinReason we ended the game

    • setCheck

      public void setCheck(Vector2 checkCoord)
      Deprecated.
      Because we currently don't use this method
      Used to set the check marker on the kings current position
      Specified by:
      setCheck in interface UIInteface
      Parameters:
      checkCoord - The Vector2 position of the king
